additionalTextInformation.text:
Judging from the photograph the painting appears to be cropped on all four sides. The remains of a family coat of arms is visible at the bottom left corner.

[cda 2021]

pageContext.description:
The painting shows the Virgin and Child against the backdrop of a mountainous landscape. The naked infant stands on a velvet cushion and is gently supported by his mother. She has inclined her head and looks with affection at her son, while offering him cherries and pea pods on a plate. She wears a plain mantle over her simple robe, and her hair is loosely bound at the nape of the neck. In the background on the right the characteristic castle is perched on top of a promontory. 
[cda 2021]

metadata.title: Virgin and Child

pageContext.provenance:
- listed in the 1933 catalogue of paintings newly acquired by the Staatlichen Museen Berlin (no. 282) [1]
[Exhib. Cat. Berlin 1937, no. 32]
- 1936 transferred from the Dresdner Bank to the collection of the Gemäldegalerie (inv. no. 2125)[2]
- 1961 restitution of the painting to the family Feist Erlen[2]
- sold at the Dorotheum, Vienna on 04.10.2006, lot 273[4]

[1][Exhib. Cat. Berlin 1937, no. 32]
[2][Note on a glass plate negative, smbGG photographic archive]
[3]'1961 abgegeben' (handed over) [Cat. Berlin 1996, 615]
[4][Dorotheum online database, accessed 02.03.2021](https://www.dorotheum.com/de/l/5075441/)

titles.title: The Virgin offering the Child a Plate of Cherries
